nodes.bodyText:
I think this paragraph might be too specific. I think the XML code example is good to have, but the description could be more general by referring to the existing relevant documentation.
The Handler needs to be added to the server classpath. https://www.eclipse.org/jetty/documentation/current/startup-classpath.html
Then it can be added to the server, either by overriding some existing XML configuration files such as jetty.xml, or by defining a custom module as described at https://www.eclipse.org/jetty/documentation/current/custom-modules.html.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -170,6 +170,27 @@ This is typically used to pass a request to a link:{JDURL}/org/eclipse/jetty/ser
 * link:{JDURL}/org/eclipse/jetty/server/handler/HandlerList.html[`HandlerList`] - A list of handlers that are called in turn until the request state is set as handled.
 * link:{JDURL}/org/eclipse/jetty/server/handler/ContextHandlerCollection.html[`ContextHandlerCollection`] - A collection of Handlers, of which one is selected by best match for the context path.
 
+[[injecting-handlers]]
+==== Injecting Handlers
+
+A custom handler can be injected using an injection based XML:
+[source, xml]
+----
+<?xml version="1.0"?>
+<!DOCTYPE Configure PUBLIC "-//Jetty//Configure//EN" "http://www.eclipse.org/jetty/configure_9_3.dtd">
+<Configure id="Server" class="org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server">
+    <Call name="setHandler">
+        <Arg>
+            <New id="myCustomJettyHandler" class="com.my.handler.CustomJettyHandler" />
+        </Arg>
+    </Call>
+</Configure>
+----
+
+* The custom handler JAR should be available at `/path/to/myjettybase/lib/ext/`
+* The custom handler XML should be available at `/path/to/myjettybase/etc/`
+* The custom handler XML should be loaded into the jetty instance at the right point in the XML load order by declaring it to be used in a custom INI

nodes.bodyText:
@lachlan-roberts Thanks for your suggestion. Does this look good? If yes, I will commit this change.
==== Injecting Handlers
The Handler needs to be added to the server classpath as described here.
Then it can be added to the server, either by overriding some existing XML configuration files such as jetty.xml as shown below, or by defining a custom module as described here.
XML Code here.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -170,6 +170,27 @@ This is typically used to pass a request to a link:{JDURL}/org/eclipse/jetty/ser
 * link:{JDURL}/org/eclipse/jetty/server/handler/HandlerList.html[`HandlerList`] - A list of handlers that are called in turn until the request state is set as handled.
 * link:{JDURL}/org/eclipse/jetty/server/handler/ContextHandlerCollection.html[`ContextHandlerCollection`] - A collection of Handlers, of which one is selected by best match for the context path.
 
+[[injecting-handlers]]
+==== Injecting Handlers
+
+A custom handler can be injected using an injection based XML:
+[source, xml]
+----
+<?xml version="1.0"?>
+<!DOCTYPE Configure PUBLIC "-//Jetty//Configure//EN" "http://www.eclipse.org/jetty/configure_9_3.dtd">
+<Configure id="Server" class="org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server">
+    <Call name="setHandler">
+        <Arg>
+            <New id="myCustomJettyHandler" class="com.my.handler.CustomJettyHandler" />
+        </Arg>
+    </Call>
+</Configure>
+----
+
+* The custom handler JAR should be available at `/path/to/myjettybase/lib/ext/`
+* The custom handler XML should be available at `/path/to/myjettybase/etc/`
+* The custom handler XML should be loaded into the jetty instance at the right point in the XML load order by declaring it to be used in a custom INI

nodes.bodyText:
Yep, the content looks good to me.
But maybe just wait to hear what @WalkerWatch has to say before making the changes.
I think there is also some special way to have internal links to different sections of the documentation, instead of having the URL links.

nodes.bodyText:
I see. Is it using the GITBROWSEURL? I was actually checking some of the GITBROWSEURL based URLs and figured those links are broken. For example, the ServerWithAnnotations.java link in this section: https://github.com/eclipse/jetty.project/blob/jetty-9.4.x/jetty-documentation/src/main/asciidoc/administration/annotations/quick-annotations-setup.adoc#embedding
cc: @WalkerWatch

nodes.bodyText:
In writing-custom-handlers.adoc there is an example which should be similar:
See the section on xref:basic-architecture[] to understand more about Handlers vs. Servlets.

So maybe xref:startup-classpath[] and xref:custom-modules[] will do the links you need.

nodes.bodyText:
I think xref is used to link to various sections within the same page.
For example, in the writing-custom-handlers.doc page:

Clicking on [basic-architecture] does NOT work.
But clicking on Generating a Response in the Handling Requests section does work.

nodes.bodyText:
I think that is just broken when you view it on GitHub, it seems to work on the documentation pages here https://www.eclipse.org/jetty/documentation/current/jetty-handlers.html
And I just checked it also works if you build locally and go to /jetty-documentation/target/docbkx/html/jetty-handlers.html. We want to avoid linking to the URL if possible because it will break if there are different versions of the documentation, say for jetty 9.4.x and 10.0.x.
